entry.title: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a dimension in a SAC table?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a dimension in a SAC table?
For example:
The dimension item “year-month” displays the values “2019004”, ‘2019005’, and “2019005” as shown below.
In this case, is it possible to retrieve the maximum value “2019005” and display it in the chart title?


If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Deleting double postings after mapping data through Data Actions
entry.content:
@N1kh1l Hello all,

I load data through CSV file where Func Area and Plant = #. I have made this data action to map combinations to correct Func Area (I dont care about Plant) looking up budget data from last year. It maps correctly, however the old combinations stays there. I have tried saving the data before mapping on a variablemember and a if statement that deletes if input = temp version. However, there are sometimes a few new combinations that wasnt there last year in budget Version. I don't want to delete them. With this method, I delete them also unfortunately.

Do anyone have an idea, where I only delete the old combinations (that is still on func area = # ) that have been mapped? Or better, dont make double transactions.

@N1kh1l  ?

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/FUNC_AREA], [d/COST_CENTER], [d/PROFIT], [d/Plant], [d/GL_ACCOUNT]

//SCOPE
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/From_Date] TO [d/Version].[p/To_Date]
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = ("Amount_LC")

VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMP OF [d/Version] 
VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMPBUDGET OF [d/Version]

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/Plant]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/Plant] = "#"

//DATA WRITING
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Input", [d/FUNC_AREA] = "#")
* (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")) / RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")))

entry.title: SAC Data Analyzer - update data source after changes
entry.content:
Hi Community

I'm facing the issue where I have a saved analysis in SAP Analytics Cloud  data analyzer, and after we've made changes to the analytical data model in SAP Datasphere it does not return any data. Only after resetting the data source does it return data. The problem is that the reset action also resets all the actions that you've performed (selections, filtering, drill etc) in data analyzer. Is there any way to update the data source without loosing all the work you've done?

Thanks

entry.content:
Hello all,

Can anyone please help me understand the purpose and difference between Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning and Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation in IFP OPEX? I’m unable to grasp this point. I can clearly understand expense planning, project expense planning, and even activity cost rate planning — but I don’t quite see the need for incorporating Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation.

I get the error message saying:

"Cannot convert from convert from array of string into Array of VariableValues "

Can you help me?

Thanks

entry.title: Export Story Table Data Directly to File Server in SAC
entry.content:
Hey everyone, 

I need to implement a data export from a Story using a button.
The idea is to export the data that is displayed in an existing table inside the Story.

However, I don’t want the export to be saved locally on the user’s machine (as a CSV/XLSX/PDF download). Instead, I would like the exported file to be automatically saved into a File Server location.

The connection already exists in the system through which data is imported.

Is there a way to achieve this in SAP Analytics Cloud Story?
If there is, how can it be implemented?

 

Thank you very much in advance.

entry.title: Write and Retrieve Data in a Model Dimension from a Story Table (SAP Analytics Cloud)
entry.content:
I would like to write data into a dimension in a model directly from a table in a Story.

The flow I’m trying to achieve is:

  1. New data is entered into the table inside the Story.
  2. This data should then be written directly into a dimension of the underlying model.
  3. I also need the ability to retrieve data from the dimension back into the Story.

My main requirement is to implement this using JavaScript in a Story, and not via Data Actions.

  • Is this possible within SAC Stories?
  • If yes, how can it be achieved with scripting?
  • If not, what would be the closest workaround?

entry.title: How to maintain a constant bar color per measure, when measures are selected from Check box group
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

In my SAC Story, I have a Bar chart and no measures assigned to it first. We have a Checkbox group and all the measures were added to this measure and during run time, we have assigned one measure to chart(Unrestricted). As you can see its in Blue color as below.

Users can play around with measures in Check box group as they wish, Now when the user first uncheck the default measure and selected first measure from the list and then selected Unrestricted next and below is how the graph looks like.

We can see that the color fo Unrestricted is in Amber and The other Measure is in Blue. Now the question came from Business asking us to keep the color of Bars in same color, No matter the order they choose. Is this achievable? If Yes, Please help me on this. I'm struggling to address this issue.

Regards,

Ram

entry.title: Deleting rows based on other rows - Data Action
entry.content:
Dear Community,

Option 1 

We start from a situation like the one shown in the table below.

ACCOUNTVIEWENTITYDATASOURCEDFCUSTCHCCMARKPRTCSCINTAmount
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20INPSTKDELRET#CNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETCNYCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETEURCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETIDRCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETINRCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETJPYCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETSGDCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETUSDCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETVNDCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1#CX20INPSTK##CNY#FTB998###1000

The requirement is to selectively delete the ADD rows; the only rows that should remain are those with equal PR and CC values (as in the final table).

ACCOUNTVIEWENTITYDATASOURCEDFCUSTCHCCMARKPRTCSCINTAmount
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20ADDSTKDELRETCNYCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1#CX20INPSTK##CNY#FTB998###1000

Option 2
We start from a situation such as that shown in the table

ACCOUNTVIEWENTITYDATASOURCEDFCUSTCHCCMARKPRTCSCINTAmount
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20INPSTKDELRET#CNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1#CX20INPSTK##CNY#FTB998###1000

Here, the requirement is to report where CC = # is present, the same CC present in the row where the following dimensions are the same: ENTITY, DATASOURCE, DF, PR.

In this case, the result would be as follows

ACCOUNTVIEWENTITYDATASOURCEDFCUSTCHCCMARKPRTCSCINTAmount
ACCOUNT1V00RCX20INPSTKDELRETCNYCNFTB998CNYCOMM#1000
ACCOUNT1#CX20INPSTK##CNY#FTB998###1000

Would either option work? What Data Action (Advanced Formula) needs to be created to achieve this result?
Obviously, these are sample data; in the data set there are more PRs and different combinations.

Thank you

entry.title: How to Access Custom Widget Event Payload (onMapClick) in SAC Analytic Applications
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
I am developing a custom widget in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) using the ArcGIS JavaScript API.
In the widget manifest (GeoMap.json), I defined a custom event onMapClick.
In the component (component.js), I dispatch the event with payload:
this.dispatchEvent(
new CustomEvent("onMapClick", {
detail: { lat, lon, radiusKm }
})
);
After connecting the configuration file and re-importing, the onMapClick event is visible in the Analytic Application events panel, and I can attach an event handler.
Issue:
Inside the SAC scripting environment, I cannot access the event payload.
Neither event nor thisEvent variables are recognized.
When I try event.detail.lat or event.detail.lon, I get “unknown variable” errors.
Expectation:
I want to consume the event payload (lat/lon/radiusKm) in my SAC application script when the event is triggered.
Question:
How can I correctly access the payload of a custom widget event in SAC scripting?
Is there a specific way SAC passes event.detail into the scripting editor?
Any guidance or example would be really helpful.

is it possible to write a table output from SAC to SharePoint? if possible, please send the steps to follow?

Govardhan

entry.title: Why SAP BTP Is the Architect’s New Canvas
entry.content:
Introduction

In the evolving world of enterprise IT, solution architects need a development platform that balances agility with structural integrity and SAP BTP delivers just that. It’s not merely a technology stack but it's a canvas where business intent meets technical artistry.

1. BTP Through the Architect’s Lens

SAP BTP combines application development, data & analytics, integration, and AI/automation into one cohesive platform. For example, you can build a microservice in CAP that pushes real-time sales data to a dashboard in SAC using Integration Suite without touching the core S/4HANA code. This helps avoid messy customizations and keeps your architecture clean.

2. Why It Matters for the Business

Using BTP isn’t just about technology but it’s about delivering results faster. Your stakeholders get real-time insights, automated processes, and new capabilities without waiting months for custom S/4HANA changes. BTP helps you stay agile while keeping systems secure and compliant.

3. The Core Pillars You Should Master

As an architect, you should be comfortable with four main areas:

  • Development & Automation: Decide when to use CAP, RAP, or low-code tools like SAP Build Apps depending on business needs and governance.
  • Data & Analytics: Use SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere to converge enterprise-wide insights with ease.
  • Integration: Integration Suite delivers APIs, workflows, Event Mesh just plug the right adapter and connect systems seamlessly.
  • Intelligence & Automation: AI services and automation close the loop from predictive insights to autonomous decision-handling

4. Why Architects Should Focus Here

  • Clean Core Strategy: Push extensions into BTP, not into S/4HANA (SAP’s clean-core philosophy).
  • Future-Proof Integrations: Use API-led patterns and composable services to stay nimble.
  • One Platform, Many Scenarios: Your SAC, CAP apps, workflows, and APIs can all live on BTP. This streamlines operations and ensures governance.
  • Pattern Reusability: Build integrations and dashboards once, and reuse them across multiple scenarios.

5. A Real-World Glimpse

Consider a manufacturing enterprise needing real-time sales dashboards. Architecting on BTP means:

Real-Time Integration: Use Integration Suite to funnel S/4HANA data through Event Mesh.

Clean Extensions: Enrich sales logic using CAP-based microservices.

Visualization: Deliver dashboards via SAP Analytics Cloud.

Governance: All components live under a unified BTP administration umbrella.

No messy SAP wrappers, no brittle custom code, just elegant, maintainable architecture.

 

Conclusion

For today’s architect, SAP BTP is less of a toolset and more of a design philosophy, a way to tie business strategy, integration, data, and intelligence into one disciplined, scalable platform. It’s a way to work smarter as an architect. Master it once, and you’re not just configuring systems, but you are shaping the future of your company’s SAP landscape.

#SAPBTP
#SAPSolutionArchitect
#SAPIntegration
#SAPAnalyticsCloud
#CleanCore

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Action
entry.content:
Hey All, 

 

Could anyone help me understand a part of the standard IFP content?
In the Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation, under the Cost Rate section, there is a data action called “Calculate CCtr Activity Cost Rates with Account-Based Split”.

Within its code, I came across the following line, and I’m unsure of its purpose. When I try debugging, it shows empty values:

DATA([d/Measures] = #M2, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #M1)

 

FOR @Counter = 1 TO 100
IF [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] != "#" THEN
// Reset #COST for next iteration
DATA([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) * 0
